Text: Now 45° Fri 52° Sat 58° by Christine Boynton PRINCESS ANNE, Md. (WBFF) -- Maryland State Police (MSP) say they are looking for four armed men involved in a shooting Thursday night in Somerset County. Investigators describe the suspects as three African- American men and one Caucasian or possibly Hispanic man. MSP troopers, Princess Anne police officers and Somerset County sheriff's deputies were called to the scene, in the area of Somerset Avenue and Oak Street, around 5 p.m. by one of the victims. Investigators say one of the victims was operating a black and tan Lincoln Town Car traveling southbound on Somerset Avenue when a burgundy Chevrolet Tahoe traveling northbound crossed the center line and struck the Lincoln Town car head on. "At the time of the crash four men reportedly exited the Tahoe," MSP wrote in a release. "Police believe at least two shots were fired into the victim's vehicle after the crash." According to police both victims ran from the vehicle and escaped unharmed. Officials are not releasing their identities. The four suspects are believed to have fled in their car which police say was later found abandoned at Loretto Road in Princess Anne. Anyone with information is urged to contact the Maryland State Police Princess Anne Barrack at (443) 260-3700. Callers may remain anonymous. 2026 Sinclair, Inc.
